name: UCF Center for Autism & Related Disabilities (CARD)
relevance: Provides resources and support for individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorders from birth through adulthood.

name: Down Syndrome Association of Central Florida
address: 204 N Westmonte Dr, Altamonte Springs, FL 32714
relevance: Offers support, resources, and programs for individuals with Down Syndrome and their families.

name: United Cerebral Palsy of Central Florida
relevance: Provides comprehensive services including therapy, education, and support for individuals with Cerebral Palsy and other disabilities.

name: Nemours Children's Hospital, Florida
relevance: Specialized pediatric hospital with departments for neurology, developmental medicine, and complex medical needs.

name: AdventHealth Rehabilitation Center
relevance: Offers inpatient and outpatient physical, occupational, and speech therapy for adults and children with mobility impairments and neurological conditions.

name: Orlando Health Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children
relevance: Top-tier children's hospital with comprehensive services for complex medical needs, developmental delays, and chronic conditions.

name: Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD) - Central Region
relevance: State agency responsible for coordinating services for Floridians with developmental disabilities, including waiver programs.

name: Center for Independent Living in Central Florida
address: 720 N Denning Dr, Winter Park, FL 32789
relevance: Provides advocacy, resources, and skills training for people with all types of disabilities to live more independently.

name: Best Buddies in Central Florida
relevance: Creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, and leadership development for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD).

name: The Arc Sunrise of Central Florida
relevance: Provides residential, employment, and life skills training for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Lake County.

name: Early Learning Coalition of Lake County
relevance: Offers resources and support for early childhood development, including programs for children with special needs and developmental delays.

name: Lakeland Regional Health - Neurology
relevance: Major regional hospital with a dedicated neuroscience and neurology department treating conditions like Epilepsy and Cerebral Palsy.

name: The Center for Autism and Related Disabilities (CARD) at USF - Polk County
address: Florida Polytechnic University, 4700 Research Way, Lakeland, FL 33805
relevance: Satellite office of USF CARD, providing direct assistance and resources to individuals and families affected by autism in Polk County.

name: New Vision for Independence
relevance: Provides training and support for individuals with low vision or blindness in Lake and Sumter counties, promoting independence.
